headline: Colbert Imagines That Boring GOP Cocaine Orgies Would Still Exclude Ted Cruz (Video)
author: Ross A. Lincoln

So it is that in the repurposed clip, presented as if it’s C-SPAN footage, Republicans attending an orgy are instead running through points of order like it’s a congressional committee meeting.
And while the imagined orgy was as “boring” as some Republicans claimed DC actually is IRL, it wasn’t so boring that attendees would let Texas Republican Ted Cruz in.
Then all of a sudden you get invited, ‘oh hey, we’re going to have a sexual get-together at one of our homes, you should come.’ What did you just ask me to come to?
Because he opened Wednesday’s episode of “The Late Show” with a cold open gag inspired by it, this time trying to imagine just what those orgies would even be like.

Then comes a knock at the door, followed by audio clips of Texas Republican Ted Cruz saying, “I’m Ted Cruz and I wanna be in the sex party.”

Stephen Colbert clearly finds GOP representative Madison Cawthorn’s claims of orgies and cocaine use among his fellow Republicans hilarious.
Minority leader Kevin McCarthy, who has already had to “speak” to Cawthorn several times before this, was among them.
As always, the cold open kicked off with a supercut of news explaining the premise, and so then shall we.
“Look, I know you’re from Iowa, but not everyone is into corn play,” the orgy’s parliamentarian says.
Why they’re so mad about something they insist isn’t true is unclear, but mad they are.
